required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: TRanscriptomic Analysis of Circulating Endothelial Cells During Sepsis - TRACES Study
clinical_study.official_title: Dysfunction and Endothelial Repair in Sepsis Shock : RNAseq Transcriptomic Analysis of Circulating Endothelial Cells

brief_summary.textblock: Vascular dysfunction is an important mechanism involved in organ failure, in the setting of sepsis condition, with different types of circulating endothelial cells.Transcriptom analysis via RNAseq in different types of circulating endothelial cells, comapring critically ill patients with or without sepsis will allow determining differential gene expression for signal pathways in endothelial alteration and restoration associated with sepsis.

primary_outcome.measure: Gene expression based on transcriptom analysis of circulating endothelial cells
primary_outcome.description: Gene expression based on transcriptom analysis of circulating endothelial cells (RNAseq)

secondary_outcome.description: Counts of circulating endothelial cells, including progenitor cells
Sequential Organ Failure Assessment (SOFA) score, ranging from 0 (best: absence of organ failure) to 24 (worse: multiple organ failure)

secondary_outcome.measure: Sequential Organ Failure Assessment (SOFA) hemodynamic sub-score
secondary_outcome.description: Sequential Organ Failure Assessment (SOFA) hemodynamic sub-score, ranging from 0 (best: absence of hemodynamic failure) to 4 (worse: hemodynamic failure)

secondary_outcome.measure: Sequential Organ Failure Assessment (SOFA) respiratory sub-score
secondary_outcome.description: Sequential Organ Failure Assessment (SOFA) respiratory sub-score, ranging from 0 (best: absence of respiratory failure) to 4 (worse: respiratory failure)

secondary_outcome.measure: Sequential Organ Failure Assessment (SOFA) neurological sub-score
secondary_outcome.description: Sequential Organ Failure Assessment (SOFA) neurological sub-score, ranging from 0 (best: absence of neurological failure) to 4 (worse: neurological failure)

secondary_outcome.measure: Sequential Organ Failure Assessment (SOFA) hematological sub-score
secondary_outcome.description: Sequential Organ Failure Assessment (SOFA) hematological sub-score, ranging from 0 (best: absence of hematological failure) to 4 (worse: hematological failure)
Death during ICU stay
Death within 28 days of intensive care unit
Death within 90 days of intensive care unit
Number of days alive without ventilation up to Day 28
Number of days alive without RRT up to Day 28
Number of days alive without vasopressors up to Day 28

secondary_outcome.time_frame: ICU length of stay, assessed up to 90 days
secondary_outcome.description: Dose of vasopressors, in patients who received vasopressors

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of intensive care unit (ICU) stay
secondary_outcome.description: Number of days alive outside the ICU up to D28
Dosage of cytokines from circulating endothelial cells
Dosage of chemokines from circulating endothelial cells

secondary_outcome.measure: Expression of membrane proteins of endothelial cells
secondary_outcome.description: Expression of membrane proteins of endothelial cells by flow cytometry
Infection site for patients with sepsis
Identified germs for patients with sepsis

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with different types of antibiotic treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Length of ICU stay, assessed up to 90 days
secondary_outcome.description: Antibiotic treatments for patients with sepsis during intensive care unit (ICU) stay

clinical_study.condition: Critical Illness With or Without Sepsis

intervention.description: Observational study. Groups are defined based on baseline patients' characteristics : presence or absence of sepsis.

study_pop.textblock: Critically ill adult patients hospitalized in an intensive care unit, with or without sepsis.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age between 18 and 85 years
- Admission in intensive care with or without sepsis
- Health insurance as per the national insurance system
- Informed and unopposed patient for participation (or referend closed one)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient under legal protection
- Patient under national medical help system
- Pregnancy
